cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi NNE of Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the Bahamas and then turning toward the Florida peninsula, with the center projected to track northward up the state

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings limited to the Dominican Republic, Haiti and the Bahamas (none in Florida at this advisory)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula and Gulf/Atlantic coasts are in the cone of uncertainty, including the west-central coast near Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40+ mph) are possible with a 45% cumulative probability; gusts could reach hurricane force if the center tracks west of forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Irma tracks up the Gulf side, water rises of 3–5 ft above ground level are possible in Tampa Bay and adjacent coast, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible, leading to flash-flooding on port facilities and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and potential debris flow affecting navigation channels and berth operations.
